channel.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
channel.description:
[AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]](https://soundcloud.com/heathenaka/antifragile-demo)
Got things I should be doing instead, but the basis came to me on the journey home last night and wanted to explore it. This piece is the result of a few hours from today — to give it some form.
Starting to play more with samples for melodies. Makes a real difference, imo.
<s>WIP/Draft. (Mix levels certainly need some attention, but I put it on SC so I can actively/passively listen to it over the next few days, and get some feedback, ahead of changes.)</s>
![image|200x200](upload://oevaaI0euhrgQbJjERziSbMSz4e.jpg)
  Thoughts, comments, feedback, would be good. :+1:

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
MisterMaster:

There’s so many little nuances

I’ve just done an edit, adding a new melody to the 1:37–2:07 section, to give it a little more interest and energy (compared to the previous 16 bars).

 

The day you release a final complete Auxy Track without it being a “sketch”, “demo” or WIP, will be a momentous occasion!

I’m actually thinking I might make this one my first actual release (Spotify, iTunes, etc…).

I’m quite happy with it, and think it might have some legs as a track. So, rather than wait until I can engineer it ‘properly’, I’m gonna pull the trigger and get it out there properly.

I’m now on the lookout for appropriate streaming playlists and promo channels (incl. YT) to pimp submit it to.

…and I need to rustle up a proper logo and some proper cover art too.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
‘Witch House’ isn’t actually a form of House music.
(Links earlier in this thread.)

It’s generally heavy, dark electronic that typically comes bundled with fx-laden vocals and sometimes occult visuals or references - hence the Witch part.

Tbh, I’m not sure where ‘House’ comes into it.

I’ve seen it used in reference to Lorn, and rejected. This thing is, strip out the occult stuff and it’s not a million miles away from what this track is.

Generically calling it Electronic doesn’t really seem like it’s adding anything useful, imo.

Ish.

Read full topic

I don’t know what “Witch House” is at all, but this track isn’t House.
It doesn’t have that steady 4 on the Floor beat, at 120-130 bpm.

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks. Really do appreciate it.

I’m not sure I agree with the ‘good mixing’. Sounds a little all over the place to my ears, lacking any subtlety.
That said, I do have a knack for making stuff worse when I try to mix ‘properly’ in Ableton.

I’ll try to not listen to it for a day or two, and visit it again with fresh(er) ears.

Well, after a couple more listens. After all, there are a couple of issues that definitely need attention (the Gravel clicking), etc… plus I’m still kinda in that ‘afterglow’ and really enjoy listening to it.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Oh Jesus at first listen I thought the viola was tonsil lol… yes, I love doing stuff like that. Like in a four minute long track or whatever you just introduce an element once. And then you don’t use it again for the rest of the track.

Listened again on headphones (listened in the truck this morning), those drums hooked me again immediately haha. I know I’m basically just repeating myself but great work. Btw sounded good in both the car and in headphones so good mixing even though it’s labeled draft / wip

Read full topic

Either way, this was great going to give it another listen later

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
iammane:

16 bar segments

Of course. I should clarify.

I never have any single segment/‘loop’ running for 16 bars.
I typically change/add/remove/build/reduce after 8, at most.

What I meant, on this instance, was that I had an 8-bar* segment which had a prominent new lead melody – that had no melodic connection either side. It’s kind of a standalone 8-bar* melody – only getting a single play-through.

I think it’s the absence of that second play-through that’s the main revelation for me. I tend to allow the listener at least two chances to hear any prominent melody.

It’s a small thing, but for me, it’s new.

 
* Technically, it’s a 4-bar melodic segment, as the effective tempo is actually 63.5bpm (rather than the 127 used within Auxy). I’ll probably nudge it to 128/64bpm.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
For what it’s worth I never ever ever build using 16 bar segments, never. I mean not that there’s anything wrong with it, but I feel like it keeps the pace moving and forces you to explore other ideas if you have a certain length in mind. Sometimes, it’s to my detriment because I explore all the ideas I wanted to in a piece in a two minute or so time window. But that’s ok, trying not to force myself to hit a certain length.

akabillposters:

I know. Music is meant to be taking a back seat for a spell, but… but… can’t… …help… …myself.

God ain’t that the truth. Longest I could go was two weeks lol. Have to always be doing SOMETHING

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Them drumsss. I’ve been digging on Thom Yorke a lot lately so this kind of drum work is right up my alley.

Glad you appreciate them. (I really should revisit all the Radiohead/Thom Yorke stuff.)

So, I’m kinda somewhere between Modeselektor and Thom Yorke. Still, those are some pretty flattering points of reference to have used with one’s music. So, no complaints.

Hopefully I can carve out my own sound. I’m certainly starting to feel like I’m starting to gravitate towards certain things, that might become ‘my sound’ – or at least, ‘my sound’ for stuff produced under a certain name.

(Feel like I’m reaching the point where I should break off certain styles into other names [and SC accounts].)

 

the more prominent lead sound that comes in is great

Thanks. As mentioned, it’s a layered combo of around four different imported sounds (actually five, as one is duplicated and panned).
With some offsetting and a touch of panning, I was able to give the lead a looser, more spacious feel.

It really helps add character to the piece, as one of the sounds has a slow, drunken vibrato, which isn’t currently possible within Auxy. (It’s a lo-fi characteristic I fell in love with back with Boards of Canada, and again more recently thanks to Lorn.)

I’ve been making a point of going through all the free and paid samples I’ve been trawling in recent months.

 

Strike while the iron is hot

I know. Music is meant to be taking a back seat for a spell, but… but… can’t… …help… …myself.

 
 
One of my key learnings from this track is to get past my tendency to build using 16-bar chunks.
Perhaps due to how little time I’ve spent on it, I was less ‘precious’. Even so, I think it’s produced a looser, more interesting composition.

For instance, the section with the Viola (4:24—4:39) is only 8-bars and the lead melody has no connection with anything either side of it.

So, my lesson from this track is to be less precious about resolving to 16-bar segments.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
If it was my song I probably not have done this lead theme so loud and “present” but something more like "ghost " and vanishing

Thanks for the compliments.

I know what you mean about the lead and I kinda agree that it’s over-the-top at the moment. I’ll likely pull it back a bit, but not to ‘ghost’ levels.

I certainly need to look at all the levels. It’s a little muddy at the moment, imo, but as mentioned, it’s kinda at draft stage.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
There’s so many little nuances

Funny you say that. I generally feel like my stuff lacks detailing. Adding subtle details and flourishes isn’t a strength – at least, not that I’m aware of.

While I’d like to be better at detailing, I’m wondering if my current amount of detailing is actually, simply a characteristic of my sound. I do enjoy simpler structures, so if this track could be considered nuanced and detailed, then perhaps this is where I should pitch my tent and consolidate the other aspects of my sound.

 

I sit here smiling like a fool as each new part plays.

Really glad you had that experience with this piece.

 

That lead, …

Yep. Starting to play with tonal samples and pushing it around using Pitch Automation to make melodies.
Makes such a difference to step away from the stock sounds and play with sounds I find more emotive and inspiring.

(I just hope they find a way to make samples ‘playable’ in an Auxy update soon.)

 

the supporting guitar-like sounds…

Cool that you caught that. Adds a hint of twang. It’s not actually a guitar. It’s built using a twangy synth. Layered over the three other sounds, one of which is a kind of tube-ish, drunken woodwind and the other two are thin rezzy, it all creates a sound with a lot of character.

Definitely the way forward — for me.

 

and the brief strings … so good.

Thanks.
Tbh, on later listens, I’m torn whether to keep that strings bit near the end.
The whole piece feels so strongly electronic/synthetic, that it seems a bit random and incongruous — kinda coming outta nowhere.

I’ll certainly keep that brief melody segment, but I may end up replacing the plaintive Viola with something else.

Alternatively, I may introduce a little of it earlier, so that it’s not so ‘outta nowhere’ later on.

 

The day you release a final complete Auxy Track without it being a “sketch”, “demo” or WIP, will be a momentous occasion!

#tellmeaboutit

 
…and, btw, thanks for the repost. Appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thanks for the feedback. Appreciated.

Btw, there’s now a section for WIP tracks if you didn’t know.

I somehow completely missed it. Thanks for heads up and thanks @MisterMaster for moving it.

 

The dubby wub at the beginning (not the very first one with the panning) has a little spikey thing that I can’t really explain

I know what you mean. The low, rezzy Gravel bass ‘wub’ is clicking.
At first, I thought it was because I hadn’t cleaned up the Lowpass settings, so that it ends at the same level as it begins. (The ‘jump’ in the soundwave can produce an intermittent click in the sound engine.)

I aligned the in/out better, and it has reduced it, but not eliminated it completely, even when soloed.
I guess the Auxy sound engine is struggling a bit.

Might need to output the wave, find a click-free loop and use that.

 

…whatever genre that is.

Your guess is as good as mine. I defaulted to the generic ‘electronic’.

Aside from the additional ‘IDM’ tag, I keep hearing ‘Witch House’ used for Lorn (who’s one of my main influences at the moment). Reading up on it, it kinda fits, ish, though I don’t relate to any of the associated, occult visuals.

Maybe I’ll use Witch House as a secondary genre. It’s close enough, imo, to be relevant and hopefully interesting enough to attract listeners of that genre.

‘Dark electro’ might be another one.

Read full topic

I like a lot your track. I would de proud to reach this level of "unfinished " track ! If it was my song I probably not have done this lead theme so loud and “present” but something more like "ghost " and vanishing. But this is my feeling and your music :-). Great job!

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Once again, I this track.

There’s so many little nuances (little nuggets of enjoyment) revealed along the way & attention to detail - that it inspires me to spend more time on my own tracks. I sit here smiling like a fool as each new part plays.

That lead, the supporting guitar-like sounds and the brief strings … so good.

The day you release a final complete Auxy Track without it being a “sketch”, “demo” or WIP, will be a momentous occasion!

Read full topic

item.title: AKA.SND - Antifragile [Electronic, IDM, Witch House?]
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
Btw, there’s now a section for WIP tracks if you didn’t know.

Only one small thing that I didn’t really like about it. The dubby wub at the beginning (not the very first one with the panning) has a little spikey thing that I can’t really explain, but right when every wub starts you can hear a little tick. Very small detail but definitely look into it.

Other than that, I’d say that the drums can be changed up a bit, specifically maybe a quicker tap on the hi-hats. Nothing really wrong about how it is now, I just think it might sound better.

P.S. I really liked it. Not the typical thing I’d listen to, but it almost makes me want to get into whatever genre that is.

Read full topic

Got things I should be doing instead, but the basis came to me on the journey home last night and wanted to explore it.
This piece is the result of a few hours from today — to give it some form.

Starting to play more with samples for melodies. Makes a real difference, imo.
